_comments._editing_guide: The fields below can be edited to customize the department page content. These texts will appear on the public website.
_comments._introText: Short introduction that appears at the top of the department page
_comments._descriptionText: Detailed description - you can use placeholder variables like {jurisdiction.name}, {department.name}, etc.
_comments._roleText: Description of the department's role and importance to the province
_comments._programsHeading: Heading for the programs and services section
_comments._programsDescription: Description of what programs and services this department offers

introText: The Ministry of Labour, Immigration, Training and Skills Development supports workforce development, workplace safety, and immigration settlement, helping build Ontario's skilled workforce.
descriptionText: The Ontario Ministry of Labour, Immigration, Training and Skills Development spent $1.6B in fiscal year (FY) 2023-24, representing 0.8% of the $206.6B in total provincial spending. This investment supports employment, training, and workplace safety.
roleText: A skilled and safe workforce is essential for Ontario's economic success. This ministry provides employment services, ensures workplace safety, supports immigration settlement, and develops the skills Ontario needs.
programsDescription: The Ministry of Labour, Immigration, Training and Skills Development operates programs including Employment Ontario, apprenticeship training, workplace safety oversight, immigration settlement services, and skills development funding.
